definition: sb who has come back to China after gaining overseas experience (a pun on 海龜|海龟[hai3 gui1])/to return to China after a period of study or work overseas
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: Now the business opportunities available on the mainland are at least as big a draw for returnees.
sentences.chinese: 现在大陆的商机至少对海归是一个巨大的吸引。

sentences.english: "A returnee brings knowledge and experience that a local Chinese does not," he says.
sentences.chinese: “海归有中国当地人没有的知识和经历，”他讲道。

sentences.english: Non-returnee entrepreneurs and talents are welcome to join us.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎非海归的创业者和各路人才加入我们。

sentences.english: The sailor put his spear gun away since he returned from sea.
sentences.chinese: 水手离海归家以后就把捕鱼枪搁起来了。

sentences.english: Non-returnee entrepreneurs and talents from all walks of life are also welcome to join us.
sentences.chinese: 非海归的创业者和各路人才也非常欢迎加入我们。

sentences.english: Non-returnee entrepreneurs and talents from all walks of life are welcome to join us.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎非海归的创业者和各路人才加入我们。

sentences.english: Some scientists with weaker résumés have shunned returnees.
sentences.chinese: 有些知名度不够的国内科学家排斥这些海归科学家。

sentences.english: All of the 11 chief scientists in Shanghai are returnees.
sentences.chinese: 上海十一位首席科学家青一色是“海归派”人士。

definition: higher education record/record including Master's or Doctoral degree
student studying abroad/(foreign) exchange student/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to study abroad (old term)/same as 留學|留学
master's degree/person who has a master's degree/learned person
to go abroad/to leave the country/emigration
foreign enterprise/company established in mainland China with direct investment from foreign entities or from investors in Taiwan, Macao or Hong Kong/abbr. for 外資企業|外资企业
to go home (to one's native country)/to return from abroad
